meanings.definition: The process of making copies using electrostatic charges.
meanings.sent1: Xerography is a method of copying documents without using ink.
meanings.sent2: She made a xerography of the report for her records.
meanings.sent3: The xerography machine decided to take a break and refused to copy any more papers.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a xerography, duplicating every detail he saw.
meanings.sent5: The xerography process revolutionized the way offices handled paperwork.

meanings.sent1: He handed her a xerography of the contract to review.
meanings.sent2: The xerography was clear and crisp, just like the original document.
meanings.sent3: The xerography seemed to have a mind of its own, making duplicates at will.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a xerography, storing exact replicas of past events.
meanings.sent5: The xerography she made was so accurate that it was hard to tell it apart from the original.
